Fields.DialogueText: *KABOOM*
We're under attack! To your positions!
Daijobusu, Kanchou! Watashi ni makasete!
@BATTLE
What a battle! Good work as usual, Sōryū.
Azassu, Kanchou! Anyway, I'd better dash. I was right in the middle of something.
Something more pressing than your official duties, no doubt.
Kanchou, I'm hurt! Do I look like the kind of Belle who would shirk their responsibilities?
... Is that a trick question?
Tehe, you know me too well. I was finishing up my latest project! I've nearly finished building a brand new motorcycle!
Dear Lord, your room must be a sight for saw eyes.
Luckily, I'm softer on the eyes than a pair of marshmallow contacts so it balances out! Anshinshite, Kanchou, I'll make sure to tidy up after I'm done.

Fields.MenuText: What model are you building?

Fields.DialogueText: A little of model A, a little of model B. Beggars can't be choosers; think of this as the Frankenstein of motorcycles.
Although, I would like to fit a Harley Davidson engine to it if possible. I can't wait to hear that purr!

Fields.MenuText: Is the war not aggressive enough? Have you thought of pursuing a more civilized hobby like flower arranging?

Fields.DialogueText: That's what retirement is for, Kanchou! I could hardly do such manual labor as a pensioner now, could I?!

Fields.MenuText: Where do you plan to ride this bike when it's complete?

Fields.DialogueText: When not attending to any pilots, that runway should be put to good use, don't you think?
You know, I could always use a spare pair of hands if you're interested?
Well, we don't have any immediate actions that need be taken. I suppose I could tinker with it a little.
Yatta! It's in the middle of my quarters. Here's the key to my room. You can just bring it up onto the deck. Make sure you lift with you legs and not with your back to avoid injury. Makaseru~
*Sigh* I should have known better...
Nearly there... nearly there... and drop it!
*BANG*
*Wheeze* *Cough* You could have helped a little...
Otsukare, Kanchou! Now we can get to work. Kochi kitte, let me show you what to do.
You really know your stuff, huh?
You better believe it!

Fields.MenuText: What attracted you to building instead of buying?

Fields.DialogueText: If we don't use these spare parts, they'll end up rusting away in someone's basement. Just because something looks useless doesn't mean it can't be put to good use if given the proper support!

Fields.MenuText: I didn't realize Japan had such a thriving motorcycle culture.

Fields.DialogueText: We don't... yet! Wouldn't it be a sight to see a horde or riders rolling down a highway? Kakkoissu, ne!

Fields.MenuText: How fast can one of these bad boys run if given the space?

Fields.DialogueText: Yabaissu, Kanchou! You shouldn't ask ME of all people something like that! You've seen how fast my planes are, why would my bikes be any slower!
So, you can reach speeds of up to 400mph?
On a good day... with the wind in my favor!
Am I doing this right?
Sugoissu, Kanchou! You're a natural. Just let go of that right there and we're finished!
*KLANGKACKLANGKLANG*
*THUD*
We're going to need some more parts...
*ALARM*
Perhaps we could salvage some from these Morganas?
Just what I was thinking, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
This bike is being particularly rebellious today. No matter how much I tighten each screw, they come loose in a second!
No need to kick me while I'm down, Kanchou... I get it, this one's a flop...
I wasn't trying to insinuate anything. If anyone can get this troublemaker up and running, it's likely to be you, right?
Hm?
After all, you know what makes troublemakers tick better than anyone.
*SLUG*
Nani ittendayo?! Hayaku, let's get back to work.
I don't think you realize how hard your punches are...
Don't worry about me, Kanchou. I'll never quit. I wouldn't want to give THEM the satisfaction.

Fields.MenuText: "Them?"
You were quick to leap aboard the self-deprecation train. Do you think people inherently expect you to fail?
You don't sound vey fond of your own people.

Fields.DialogueText: Just about everyone I've ever met! If people expect me to fail, I'll prove them wrong out of nothing but pure spite!

They'd never say it to my face but I can tell. My clothes, my tattoo, my hobbies. Nothing about me seems to fly with people back home. Luckily, being an aircraft carrier means I can fly wherever I please.
Chigau, chigau! I love Japan and Japanese people, they're just a little rigid. Give it five or ten years and they'll come around. If only I could fly into the future!
Well, regardless, I think you're doing a fine job with the Morganas. If you ever need someone to co-sign a declaration of successful duties, I'll be there.
Did you hear what I--?
*SLUG*
Ow!
Azassu!
*ALARM*
Morganas!
Let's return after we deal with them!
@BATTLE
It's nice to get off the ship and stretch our legs!
Don't get too complacent. We're here to resupply. Just because we've yet to receive new orders doesn't mean we have the excuse to slack off.
We've been running into an awful lot of Morganas lately. Do you think we should pick up some new weaponry while we're docked?

Fields.MenuText: Not a bad idea.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm full of them!

Fields.MenuText: Nice try.

Fields.DialogueText: It was worth a shot!
Oi~! Kanchou, mite! A spare parts salesman. Maybe he'll have the part I need to finally get the bike up and running!
We have time. Let's question the fellow.
Sasen, I was wondering if you have something like the part on this flyer?
*Sniff* Maybe's I dos, maybe's I don'ts. Whatsit to youse?
Aren't you a salesman? I'm an eager customer.
Maybe, I can tell by the looks of ya that you can't afford it even if I dos got it. Now beat it!
We're not getting anywhere arguing.
*ALARM*
Say we head back to the ship then test our luck again.
Ossu!
@BATTLE
Sasen. We were wondering if you would reconsider selling us that part?
I ain't sellin' to no criminal. Besides... I don't like the way she's...
*GLAAAAARE*
Lookin' at me...
We really need that part and would be greatly indebted to you if--
Could you give us a minute?
Take an hour...
Are you feeling all right?
Sasen, Kanchou. Even if it's just one person, I really hate having to put forward any kind of case… I just freeze up!

Fields.MenuText: You should have corrected him. You're no criminal.

Fields.DialogueText: I prefer to let the babies have their bottle. If I must act as the lightning rod to justify the stereotypical image people have of criminals then so be it.
At least it helps them remain vigilant to incoming danger.

Fields.MenuText: That glare was rather intimidating.

Fields.DialogueText: It takes most of my energy to formulate the sentence I can't keep track of what the rest of my face is doing!

Fields.MenuText: You don't seem that nervous when speaking to me.

Fields.DialogueText: Your face is soothing, Kanchou. Like a puppy or a newborn child. I'm surprised even the Morganas can take such a face seriously!
Thank... you...?
You've spoken with superior officers before. What did you do at that time?
Fake it 'til I make it, mostly. I'm pretty good at "sounding" formal if the situation necessitates it. I can put on almost any act if push comes to shove.
*ALARM*
Let's deal with these Morganas. Then have another crack at that salesman. I've got an idea. It's a technique I devised myself. I call it; "Good Captain, Bad Belle." Follow my lead!
Ussu!
@BATTLE
Oi, Ossan!
What is it this--!
Kora!
Eep!
You gonna sell us that part or not?!
I... I already... told you...
You want money? Kanchou!
Yes, Miss Sōryū! Here, we have money, look.
So you do...
You have to sell us that part. There's no telling what she'll do to us if you don't.
What's TAKING SO LONG?!
Right away, Ma'am!
Please, she's crazy. If not for your own safety then for mine. If I return with the part in tow, I may be given permission to have dinner this evening.
I'm going to count backwards from three and when I get to one, that part better be in my hand. Three... two...!
Okay, okay! Just, please don't hurt me!
Tch! You made the right choice, Ossan.
*ALARM*
If you like, look out onto the water and see the fate that could have befallen you. Had you chosen to aggravate my very last nerve that is.
@BATTLE
What a show! You're a surprisingly good actress!
*SLUG*
Ow!
It was your plan. Like everything about me, when it comes to learning something new, I'm just as fast.

Fields.MenuText: Have you always been such a natural talent?
If you want to improve your people skills, you should work on that stare. It's rather frightening.
I didn't think you had it in you

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know about all that. My motorbike and pilots would be ashamed of my body if it couldn't pick things up as quickly they adapt to new terrain.
Work on the death glare, got it!
Hiryu is the one most people look toward when it comes to perfection. It's like she's a better version of me with all the kinks ironed out.
But seemingly useless things can still function if given the proper support! Be it motorcyle parts or Belles alike!
Let's get back on the ship and test this new part out! We'll likely have to deal with a few Morganas as we head out to sea but it's nothing we can't handle!
Yes, ma'am!
@BATTLE
It's all about proving that everything I do can be done to perfection!
A perfect fit! With this in place, I can get the bike in gear in no time!

Fields.MenuText: And we couldn't have done it without your superb acting skills.

Fields.DialogueText: *SLUG*
Ow!
It was nothing!

Fields.MenuText: I'm proud of you for not rising to his insults.

Fields.DialogueText: *SLUG*
Ow!
If a Morgana barrage can't break my hull, a few rude words won't leave a scratch!

Fields.MenuText: I think it's great you pursue your passions no matter what anyone says.

Fields.DialogueText: *SLUG*
Ow!
If I don't pursue my passions, who else will?!
Sōryū... I've been meaning to say something... could you come by my office?
*ALARM*
Ussu. Let me handle these Morganas and I'll head down!
@BATTLE
You wanted to see me, Kanchou?
Yes, could you come here?
Chikaissu, ne... Do I really need to stand this close...? Hazukashissu...
You've been doing really well lately.
*SLUG*
Ow!
Iisu, ne, I thought this was going to be a disciplinary hearing. You just wanted to compliment me!
You work against the Morganas has been exceptional.
*SLUG*
Ow!
Yarisuginai, Kanchou? I could get used to this!
I'm very proud of everything you-- FREEZE! Look at your hand.
What are you...? Ara! I've been hitting you...

Fields.MenuText: You have. Every time I encourage you or offer the slightest praise.
I'm glad you realized. My arm's beginning to look like a bruised peach.
Took you long enough!

Fields.DialogueText: Forgive me, it's always been me against the world. I don't really know what to do with such words. I guess my body can't register them as anything more than sarcasm and it subconsciously lashes out.
It's fine, really. I just thought I better let you know before I end up in a sling.
Gomen'ne, Kanchou. I don't want you to think your kind words are falling on deaf ears. I truly appreciate your support.
*SLUG*
Ita!
Don't mention it.
*ALARM*
Shall we?
Ussu!
@BATTLE
We've just had a report that an aircraft will be making an emergency landing. They say he was lucky to escape with his life after running low on fuel in the middle of a Morgana attack.
Hidoissu, ne... Nary a day goes by that I don't fret over the lives of my pilots.
His plane looks to be in a bad way from the battle as well. We're to patch both it and the pilot up before sending him on his way.
Leave it to me, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: I can't help but feel as though this wouldn't have happened had you been in charge.

Fields.DialogueText: Well... I wasn't going to say anything but... I would never have let my pilots head out on a mission with their plane in such a state. Morganas are the only threat my pilots need worry about.

Fields.MenuText: I know you can take care of a plane but how are your nursing skills?

Fields.DialogueText: Anshinshite, Kanchou. I may joke around ocassionally but I take these matters deathly serious.
He should be arriving any moment. Let us head to the deck and eliminate any Morganas in the area.
Ussu!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: I'll be sure to send a scathign message to those in charge of fueling his plane.

Fields.DialogueText: I too would enjoy adding some choice words to the end of that letter!
Here he comes, Kanchou!
Careful, now - give him space to land.
*ALARM*
Damn Morganas! Always trying to take advantage of us when we're at our most vulnerable.
I'll handle them, Kanchou. You focus on ensuring the pilot is all right!
@BATTLE
Steady now, we've got you.
*Thud*
Thank you kindly. I thought I was a goner there.
We'll get you and your plane patched up in no time.
Don't worry about me. I'm right as...
*Thud*
Quickly! Take him to triage! We'll run a full medical check.
We'll dock soon. Head into port for me. Pick up anything you'll think we need to treat him and the aircraft.
The Morganas are coming in by the bucketload recently. Do I have your permission to upgrade our firepower while docked?

Fields.MenuText: If you think it necessary.

Fields.DialogueText: Ussu! You won't regret it!

Fields.MenuText: Let's focus on the pilot first and rearm later.

Fields.DialogueText: Wakarimashita!
Do you think the pilot'll be all right?
In your hands? How could he not be?
I'd better not. We don't have the same freedom to tinker that you have with your bike.
No sidecar. Got it!
You think he'll be all right?

Fields.MenuText: For the ship, right?

Fields.DialogueText: Why? You picky?
No, I just doubt that anything you can mount on your bike will be able to put a dent in the Morganas.
Won't know until I try!
One thing at a time.
Haaaai.
Are you sure it's okay for me to tend to the pilot in your quarters, Kanchou? Jama jya nai no?
We're out of available beds at the moment. I have no qualms letting him rest up somewhere comfortable.
He passed out as soon as he landed. It must have taken every ounce of willpower to make it here alive.

Fields.MenuText: Fixing planes, fixing bikes, and now fixing people. I never knew you were so dedicated to keeping things going.

Fields.DialogueText: When it comes to people's lives, I'm deathly serious.

Fields.MenuText: You always were one to give it 110%.

Fields.DialogueText: I may enjoy the occasional joke but I would not have joined the war effort to play around.

Fields.MenuText: He's a real trooper. Like someone else I know.

Fields.DialogueText: Pfft! I wouldn't have passed out from something as small as the sudden realization that my demise may be imminent.
Thus having microseconds left to either forge an escape plan or come to terms with my own death! For me, that's an average Tuesday!
*ALARM*
Kanchou, would you mind changing his cloth? I will deal with the distress signal upstairs.
Of course.
Azassu!
Oh, one more thing!
Hm?
Stop and take a breath when you get a chance.
Ussu!
@BATTLE
GAH!
You're finally awake.
We though we might have lost you for a minute there.
You are... Right, my team were wiped out and... I made it back here.
What happened? Spare us no detail.
It's all a blur... The Morganas were picking us off one by one. I tried to help my comrades but, had I done so, I wouldn't have had enough fuel to escape.
I see.
I chose the coward's way out and ran...
Don't beat yourself up. You chose to live as anyone else would. The ones who sent you into battle with minimal fuel are to blame.

Fields.MenuText: Would anyone still be alive?

Fields.DialogueText: My interim captain was supporting the air team from his ship. There's a chance he managed to fight his way out. I have to go find him as soon as possible.

Fields.MenuText: Are you feeling all right now?

Fields.DialogueText: Much better. Thank you. Although...

Fields.MenuText: Likely a way to cut costs.

Fields.DialogueText: I was thinking the same. When will people learn that training an brand new pilot will always cost more than a little extra fuel?
Thank you very much for your hospitality but I'll be out of your hair in n-- AH!
Ba~ka, who said you could move? You're not going anywhere until that plane is fixed, so use the time to restore your energy.
*nods*
*ALARM*
That's our cue. Sōryū, let's take our frustrations out on these Morganas!
@BATTLE
Oi, Kanchou! Do you have a moment? Please sit with me.
Sure, is there a problem?
I've been working on the plane in my free time and I noticed a few things.
Like what?
Well, namely, the engine is a bodge job. It's suffered serious damage and only the bare minimum has been done to keep it from exploding.
Is that so?
The tires are shot, the wings are loose... That aircraft is in no shape to fly. I wouldn't trust it as a paperweight in its current state!

Fields.MenuText: Can you fix it?

Fields.DialogueText: Mochiron - but that isn't the issue. That man is lucky to be alive and we have no one to blame but his superiors.

Fields.MenuText: I can see the benefit of your multiple checks.

Fields.DialogueText: Some eager pilots are annoyed at my studiousness but it's all for the sake of safety.

Fields.MenuText: Do you think he knows about this?

Fields.DialogueText: I wouldn't be surprised if he was either told to keep quiet or holds too much respect for his superiors to complain.
*ALARM*
I for one cannot sit idly by and send that young man to his grave. Let's discuss this with him after you get it up and running.
Ussu!
@BATTLE
Kanchou! You'll be pleased to hear that the work on the plane is 99% completed!
That's great news!
Issu, ne! I'm, looking forward to returning to the bike!
May I have a look?
*ALARM*
Un! I'll meet you there!
@BATTLE
Jya, what do you think?

Fields.MenuText: It looks completely different!

Fields.DialogueText: I streamlined a lot of it.

Fields.MenuText: It looks brand new!

Fields.DialogueText: Most of the bells and whistles on these things are just for show. They look good but will plummet after a light breeze.

Fields.MenuText: It looks a lot less flashy.

Fields.DialogueText: Surely, it's better to be comfortable and efficient than flashy.
I try to adopt that style in my vessel and my clothes.
Shall we inform the pilot?
I'm right behind you.
You're both smiling. Am I in for some good news?
We are pleased to announce that your aircraft is nearly at 100%!
Nearly?
It's pretty much good to go but I'd like to perform one final round of checks.
Is all that really necessary? I need to leave as soon as possible and search for my captain.
I'm afraid the answer is no.
If the plane is fit to fly, why shouldn't I be allowed to leave? Is there really nothing I can do but wait?

Fields.MenuText: If Sōryū says that's the way it is, then that's the way it has to be.
Don't go rushing off to your death.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm no more than a prisoner at this point.
My captain may have already met his maker. What right do I have to be lounging around when he could be in grave peril?

Fields.MenuText: All pilots must follow this rule. Why would you be any different?

Fields.DialogueText: So, there's nothing I can do but wait?
I am thankful for all that you both have done for me but I must be on my way.
Your plane was purposefully underfuelled! Your so-called righteous captain sent you out to die!
Actually, I was the one who decided to fly without enough fuel. It was the only plane available and, despite its shortcomings and the lack of spare fuel, I forged documents stating it was fit to fly.
Why...?
To support my team! I could care less for anyone who badmouths my captain, let alone you two. I will stand by those who cheer me on like my captain has done for me - a hundred times over!
I... I understand how you feel... Maybe more than anyone... But, still--!
No offense but, by the looks of that tattoo, you're not someone who listens to the rules - so why should I take the advice of a hypocrite?
That's enough!
*ALARM*
Sōryū, Morganas!
Ussu...
Flyboy, bed!
... Yes, Captain...
And for the love of all that is good, someone please get me an aspirin!
@BATTLE
The Morganas have been dealt with, Kanchou.
Are you all right?
It's a shame that pilot is so hard-headed. I can see where he's coming from. Now more than ever thanks to your advice. But...

Fields.MenuText: I know... I know.
What he said was out of line.

Fields.DialogueText: He doesn't know me so all he can do is judge me based on appearances. As does everyone else I meet. However, he was right. I shouldn't care what others think as long as those I care about support me.
I don't mean to impose such strict rules but...

Fields.MenuText: He'll come around. Just like the rest of Japan.

Fields.DialogueText: Well said!
There's a difference between disobeying rules meant to keep us in boxes and rules meant to keep us safe.
I would never steal or injure someone in an attempt to rebel against authority or make a statement. No matter how hard I try, I can't see it in black and white.
That's because it isn't. And everytime people try to tell you it is, you have that colorful tattoo to remind you of that.
Azassu...
Hey, you didn't hit me.
*ALARM*
I was saving it for the Morganas, is all...
@BATTLE
You look to be in a chipper mood. I see you've returned to work on the motorcycle.
Ussu! I was performing my final checks on the plane and, as it turns out, someone forgot to install a key component. Without it, the plane would crash and burn after a few minutes in the sky!
Heavens. I assume someone has been sent to procure the item?
Not yet. We will dock soon and I will search for it then.
Very well. Can I be of service here?
Iisu, ne, my own personal mechanic! Or, assistant-mechanic, should I say?
Although it looks more than ready to ride.
Oh, the bike itself is good to go! But... I thought about installing a passenger side car...

Fields.MenuText: You... you aren't planning on kidnap the pilot for disobeying you, right?

Fields.DialogueText: Oi, oi, Kanchou, weren't you defending my not being a criminal status earlier?

Fields.MenuText: For who?

Fields.DialogueText: Well... The thing is...

Fields.MenuText: That sounds like a lot of work...

Fields.DialogueText: Un! Azassu!
I thought it would be fun if we went for a drive together. When it's all up and running.
Me?! In this death trap you built from nothing but worn-out--!
*Pout* Kanchou...
*Sigh* Very well. Pass me that spanner.
*ALARM*
No time! Morganas, first. Bike second!
Agreed!
@BATTLE
Hayaku, Kanchou. We need to repair that plane as quickly as possible. I know how frustrated the pilot must be feeling and I don't want to burden him any longer.
Okay, let's split up and pick up everything we need for the road ahead.
We might be a while away from port. Think we need to pack something that hits harder?

Fields.MenuText: Better safe than sorry.
We'll be fine. I trust you can handle anything.

Fields.DialogueText: Watashi mo!
Ussu!
Let's get what we need and head back to the ship. We may need to deal with several Morganas blocking our exit.
Hai, hai. Watch me ride circles around them...
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Size it for the ship.

Fields.DialogueText: What if I stick you in the sidecar and let you fire it?
Tempting.
Riiiight?
All the more reason to resist.
*pout*
Pilot-san. We've come to tell you that...
He's not here...
Oi, oi, Kanchou. Mite...
What is this? A note?
Yonde kudasai...
"Thank you very much for all your help... by the time you read this... already gone... Find my captain... Don't follow me."
Kono baka! He's going to get himself killed!

Fields.MenuText: What should we do?

Fields.DialogueText: There's no way he's left yet. We would have heard him take off.

Fields.MenuText: Let's give chase!

Fields.DialogueText: Hayaku!

Fields.MenuText: We need to fix that plane!

Fields.DialogueText: The fix can be done in seconds! If only he'd just waited!
*ALARM*
We'll head to the deck and deal with any enemies along the way!
@BATTLE
Asoko ni, Kanchou!
We've got our hands full with the Morganas! Let's deal with them first!
@BATTLE
Matte!
*WHIRRRRRRR*
I told you not to follow me!
The plane! We still need to-
Hey! Look at me!
You and me! We've got one thing in common! Tough as nails!
*WHIRRRRRRREEEEE*
Dame!
*WHOOSH*

Fields.MenuText: Is there nothing we can but watch him die?!
The fool!
How did he even make it this far without anyone stopping him?!

Fields.DialogueText: He mentioned before about forging documents. His mouth must be as smooth as his wrist.
No time for insults, Kanchou! We have to stop him!
I may have an idea! But you're not going to like it!
Don't tell me...!
Over there! The motorbike is fully complete and the sidecar is ready to go! You'll be all right without a helmet, won't you?
*VROOOOM*
When we pull up next to the plane...! You hop on and open up the compartment on the left wing! Then, all you have to do is screw this in!

Fields.MenuText: Why can't you do it?!

Fields.DialogueText: Can you drive a motorcyle?!

Fields.MenuText: What if it takes off?!

Fields.DialogueText: Ha? Kikoenai, Kanchou! The bike is too loud for me to hear anything you're saying!

Fields.MenuText: Just like that?!

Fields.DialogueText: It's a limiter to stop it from overheating! It's that simple!
*VROOOOM*
Oi~! Kono baka Pilot!
You don't give up, do you?! I respect that!
Stop the plane! You're going to die!
And risk being locked up for mutiny? I can't do that, I'm afraid.
Shōganai. Kanchou, Ima da!
HOYA!
*BOOF*
What the hell are you--! And you're worried about me getting MYSELF killed?!
Hayaku, Kanchou! Before he...
*WHIRRRRrrrrrooooosh*
Takes off...
*ALARM*
Daijōbusu, Kanchou! Just fix that plane and I'll catch you! Leave the Morganas below to me!
@BATTLE
While the engine's actually going?
That just makes it interesting!
What has this girl got me doing?! Hurtling a hundred feet above the water just to save the life of someone who'd rather die!
That's the problem with hanging around with people too stubborn for their own good, Captain! I'll be sure to send my condolences to your funeral!

Fields.MenuText: That girl has been ostracised her whole life for the choices she's made and doesn't deserve some cocky flyboy disrespecting her!

Fields.DialogueText: So, what? You so mad you won't fix my plane that's apparently about to burst into...
*CHUGUCHUGchuugggggggg*
*gulp*

Fields.MenuText: All that girl wanted to do was help you!
And I to yours!

Fields.DialogueText: Of course I'll fix it! As someone I care about once said, I wouldn't want to give you the satisfaction! I'll save you out of pure spite!
*Tinker tinker, screw screw, bang*
There! You're welcome!
You're a good person, Captain! Do me a favor! Hang onto that one! She's got guts!
*ZOOOOM*
GWAH!
Kanchou!
*SPLOOSH*
I've got you! You're okay!
And the pilot...?
He would have combusted by now if he was going to. You did it, Kanchou.
Do me a favor and handle the remaning Morganas... I don't think I'm up for it right now...
@BATTLE
*THUD*
Yabaissu, Kanchou... Mucha suiginai? You could have died!

Fields.MenuText: You told me to!
I'm no fuddy duddy desk monkey!

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't think you'd actually listen to me! Don't be afraid to put me in my place when I'm being unreasonable next time!

Fields.MenuText: Don't judge an sailor by their naval uniform.

Fields.DialogueText: From this point on, I most certainly won't!
You sure showed me, all right.... I don't suppose you'd want to try doing something like that again?
Something about that pilot didn't sit right with me. Until the very end, he just couldn't see you were trying to help him.
I understand. It wasn't until recently that I learned to accept any kind of support from others. He'll get there one day if his captain is as helpful as you are.
Let's hope so.
That being said, Kanchou. Could I have a moment. After we change and rewrite our wills of course.
Of course.
*ALARM*
No rest for the wicked. I can go one more round if you can.
Mochiron!
@BATTLE
Keep at it! Drive the Morganas back!
@BATTLE
Phew! What a battle!

Fields.MenuText: I'm still thankful to be able to stand here and speak with you.

Fields.DialogueText: Watashi mo! I still can't believe you managed to hold on!

Fields.MenuText: Any word from the pilot? Did he return safely? What of his captain?

Fields.DialogueText: No word from the pilot yet but, we did all we could. The rest is up to him. We shouldn't expect him to fail, right?

Fields.MenuText: And many more to come no doubt. I trust you're prepared?

Fields.DialogueText: Mochiron!
And, unlike our pilot friend, I will never do something so reckless behind your back. Should I do something that reckless, I'll be sure to let you know what's about to happen first!
I wouldn't have it any other way.
Tehe! What do you think the future holds in store for us, Kanchou?
Whatever lies beyond the horizon, one thing is for certain...

Fields.MenuText: I wouldn't rather stand beside anybody else.
I'll be there to cheer you on until my dying breath.

Fields.DialogueText: Azassu! Yoroshissu!
